com.cs1530.group4.addendum.client

Class FlexTableHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cs1530.group4.addendum.client.FlexTableHelper

  • public class FlexTableHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    When FlexTable.FlexCellFormatter.setRowSpan(int, int, int) is used, it causes unexpected shifting for cells on rows below spanned one, because FlexTable.prepareCell(int, int) is naive and does not take into account fact of spanning (well, often setRowSpan() is invoked after adding cells, so may be we should say that setRowSpan() is guilty).

    See http://groups.google.com/group/Google-Web-Toolkit/browse_thread/thread/8a76929f78946c00 for discussion about this problem.

    In any case, this helper class tried to fix row span problem that that FlexTable can be used as normal grid with arbitrary col/row spanning.

    Author:
    scheglov_ke
